revised_title: Martin Alister Campbell Hinton: A Pioneering Naturalist and Zoologist
tldr: Martin Alister Campbell Hinton was a dedicated naturalist and zoologist who made significant contributions to the understanding of Pleistocene mammals and their use in stratigraphy and paleoecology. His work focused on rodents and the Pleistocene history of the Thames valley. Hinton also held various positions at the British Museum (Natural History) and was involved in the eradication of the musk-rat problem. His later research shifted to living rodents and whales, mainly addressing systematics and economic biology.
